summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the Epstein case, discussing victim notification and confirming the schedule for a plea and sentencing in December 2007. The email is addressed to an individual with a redacted name and mentions attempts to contact Barry and Lanna.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, discussing victim notification and confirming the schedule for Epstein's plea and sentencing.

persons.name: Barry
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the Assistant U.S. Attorney attempted to contact via email but did not receive a response from.

persons.name: Lanna
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the Assistant U.S. Attorney attempted to contact via email but did not receive a response from.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney attempted to contact Barry via email regarding the Epstein case.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney attempted to contact Lanna via email regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Scheduled Plea and Sentencing
events.description: A plea and sentencing hearing for Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled for December 2007, as referenced by the Assistant U.S. Attorney seeking confirmation.

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 26, 2007, from an Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the Epstein case.
It references victim notification procedures in the Epstein case.
It seeks confirmation that a plea and sentencing for Jeffrey Epstein were still scheduled for December 2007.
The email indicates the prosecutor had attempted to contact individuals named Barry and Lanna but had not received a response.
